outline:
1. to tear away, seize, plunder, tear off, pull off, rob, take away by force
    1. (Qal)
      1. to tear away, rob
      2. to seize, plunder (with acc cognate)
    2. (Niphal)
      1. to be robbed
      2. to be taken away
kjv_def: catch, consume, exercise (robbery), pluck (off), rob, spoil, take away (by force, violence), tear.
strongs_def: to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
